page.title: 07BURHAM - THE NEW SCHOOL
page.content: Hopes of a new school had all but disappeared but at last in January 1984 work commenced on the new building in Bell Lane. The whole village was very excited especially the school children. During the building the children were very involved with the whole atmosphere. They visited the new school site on numerous occasions to monitor progress. They also planted trees on the school site and a {time capsule} was buried outside the front entrance of the new building. Finally on 3rd June 1985 the old school was vacated and the new occupied. It was a very exciting time for all concerned. Now the children can see out of the windows, all facilities are under the one roof in a modern building.
